::: {.week-header}
## From Discrete to Continuous: Understanding Density and Intervals
This week transitions from discrete to continuous random variables, introducing probability density functions, common continuous distributions, and the foundations of statistical inference through confidence intervals. You'll learn how the Central Limit Theorem enables us to make probabilistic statements about population parameters.
:::

### 🎯 Learning Objectives & Study Plan

::: {.grid-2}
::: {.resource-card}
::: {.resource-type}
Mastery Checklist
:::

::: {.resource-title}
**Week 4 Learning Goals**
:::

::: {.resource-description}
After completing this week, you should be able to:

- [ ] **Distinguish PDFs from PMFs** and understand continuous probability
- [ ] **Work with normal distribution** including standardization and Z-scores
- [ ] **Apply the Central Limit Theorem** to sampling distributions
- [ ] **Calculate and interpret confidence intervals** for population means
- [ ] **Choose appropriate confidence levels** based on context
- [ ] **Understand factors affecting CI width** (sample size, confidence level, variability)
- [ ] **Use Python** for continuous distributions and confidence intervals
- [ ] **Interpret CI results correctly** avoiding common misconceptions
:::

### 🧮 Formula Reference Sheet

::: {.formula-reference}
**Essential Formulas for Week 4**

**Normal Distribution:**
- Standard Normal: $Z = \frac{X - \mu}{\sigma}$
- Probability: $P(a < X < b) = \int_a^b \frac{1}{\sigma\sqrt{2\pi}} e^{-\frac{(x-\mu)^2}{2\sigma^2}} dx$

**Central Limit Theorem:**
- Sampling Distribution: $\bar{X} \sim N\left(\mu, \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}}\right)$
- Standard Error: $SE = \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}}$

**Confidence Intervals:**
- General Form: $\text{statistic} \pm \text{margin of error}$
- For Means: $\bar{x} \pm z_{\alpha/2} \cdot \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}}$
- Margin of Error: $ME = z_{\alpha/2} \cdot \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}}$

**Common Z-values:**
- 90% CI: $z_{0.05} = 1.645$
- 95% CI: $z_{0.025} = 1.96$  
- 99% CI: $z_{0.005} = 2.576$
:::
